License: ImageNet Terms

<add dos - and donts>

Use the database only for non-commercial research and educational purposes.

Share access only with research associates who agree to the same terms.

Accept full responsibility for any use or derivatives created from the data.

Ensure your employer is bound by the terms if you work for a commercial entity.

Do not use the database for commercial purposes.

Do not share the database with anyone who has not agreed to the terms.

Do not assume any warranties regarding data quality, fitness, or non-infringement.

observations:
No clear request of which models are required for different objectives. 
The proposal proposes to use the double Chinchilla rule, which implies that the number of tokens is ~40 times the number of model parameters. By this measure, the expected parameters are as follows for the suggested models to be trained:
NanoGPT – 5B tokens - ~125M parameters
MediumGPT – 14B tokens - ~350M parameters
LargeGPT – 31B tokens - ~775M parameters
None of the above can reach the 10^27 threshold.

Author(s) plan to develop, scale, and train their own AI/LLM architectures from scratch.
recommendation: Need to consult with the applicant which models they wish to use. Conditional to it, recommended for grand challenge.
